name: Triazolam
summary: Triazolam is a short-acting benzodiazepine used for the short-term treatment of insomnia.
description: Triazolam, marketed under the brand name Halcion, is a short-acting benzodiazepine hypnotic used primarily for the short-term management of insomnia, especially difficulties with sleep initiation. It enhances the effect of gamma-aminobutyric acid (GABA) at the GABA-A receptor, leading to sedative, anxiolytic, muscle relaxant, and anticonvulsant effects. Due to its short half-life, triazolam is best suited for people who have trouble falling asleep rather than staying asleep. It is generally prescribed for no longer than 7–10 days to minimize risks of dependence, tolerance, and withdrawal.

contraindications: Hypersensitivity to triazolam, benzodiazepines, or formulation components
Concurrent use with strong CYP3A inhibitors

items: Short-term treatment of insomnia characterized by difficulty falling asleep

sections.text: Binds to benzodiazepine sites on the GABA-A receptor complex, enhancing GABA’s inhibitory effects and increasing chloride ion influx, resulting in hyperpolarization and reduced neuronal excitability.

adult.oral: 0.125–0.25 mg at bedtime; maximum dose 0.5 mg nightly. Use the lowest effective dose for the shortest duration possible.

geriatric.oral: 0.125 mg at bedtime; avoid higher doses due to increased sensitivity and fall risk.

other: May cause anterograde amnesia and complex sleep behaviors (e.g., sleep-driving)
Risk of dependence and withdrawal symptoms; limit use to ≤10 days
Avoid alcohol and other CNS depressants

items.risk: Increased sedation and risk of complex behaviors

items: Signs of misuse, dependence, or withdrawal
Respiratory status in patients with underlying conditions

sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; not recommended during breastfeeding
sections.geriatrics: Increased risk of falls, cognitive impairment, and paradoxical reactions; use lowest effective dose

sections.text: If used longer than a few days, gradually reduce dose to avoid withdrawal symptoms.

items: Not recommended for long-term management of insomnia
Best suited for difficulty with sleep onset, not maintenance
Educate patients on avoiding hazardous activities after dosing
